meanings.sent1: She was feeling crabby after a long day at work.
meanings.sent2: The crabby customer complained about everything in the store.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seemed crabby today, swatting at anyone who came near.
meanings.sent4: His crabby attitude was like a storm cloud hanging over the family dinner.
meanings.sent5: The crabby old man yelled at the kids to get off his lawn.

meanings.definition: Resembling a crab in behavior or appearance
meanings.sent1: The crabby movements of the robot made it look like a mechanical crab.
meanings.sent2: The crabby walk of the toddler amused everyone at the park.
meanings.sent3: The crabby dance moves of the penguin brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her crabby sideways glance reminded him of a cautious crab on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The crabby way the car moved sideways on the icy road was unexpected.
